symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField
symbols.description:
A MultiValueField control can hold multiple values. The values are stored as items. A MultiValueField control can be used to bind its items to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the MultiValueField control as follows:
  • In display mode, usually a {@link sap.m.Tokenizer Tokenizer} control is rendered.
  • If multipleLines is set, an {@link sap.m.ExpandableText ExpandableText} control is rendered.
  • In edit mode, usually a {@link sap.m.MultiInput MultiInput} control is rendered.
  • If multipleLines is set, a {@link sap.m.TextArea TextArea} control is rendered.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to the MultiValueFieldDelegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Items of the MultiValueField control.

events.name: change
events.description: This event is fired when the items aggregation of the field is changed by user interaction. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

items.name: items
items.description: The new items of the MultiValueField control. If a ValueHelp element is assigned to the MultiValueField control, the key of the items is used as key for the ValueHelp items.

valid.name: valid
valid.description: Flag that indicates if the entered user input is valid

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the items when it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the Promise has already been resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the items have been updated. The MultiValueField control should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that need to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.odata.TypeUtil
symbols.description: Provides mapping functionality for model dependent data types to base types. Extend this object in your project to customize behaviour depending on model usage. Note: This utility is experimental and the API/behavior is not finalized and hence this should not be used for productive usage.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TablePropertyInfo
symbols.description:
An object literal describing a data property in the context of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table} with {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate}. When specifying the PropertyInfo objects in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table#getPropertyInfo propertyInfo} property, the following attributes need to be specified:
  • name
  • path
  • dataType
  • formatOptions
  • constraints
  • maxConditions
  • caseSensitive
  • visualSettings.widthCalculation
  • propertyInfos
  • groupable
  • key
  • unit
  • text
  • aggregatable
  • extension.technicallyGroupable
  • extension.technicallyAggregatable
  • extension.customAggregate
  • extension.customAggregate.contextDefiningProperties
If the property is complex, the following attributes need to be specified:
  • name
  • visualSettings.widthCalculation
  • propertyInfos (all referenced properties must be specified)

properties.name: aggregatable
properties.description: Defines whether a property is aggregatable.

properties.name: extension

technicallyGroupable.name: technicallyGroupable
technicallyGroupable.description: If groupable is set to false to exclude it from group personalization on the UI, the UI still needs to know that this property is groupable for data requests.

technicallyAggregatable.name: technicallyAggregatable
technicallyAggregatable.description: If aggregatable is set to false to exclude it from aggregate personalization on the UI, the UI still needs to know that this property is aggregatable for data requests.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil
symbols.description: Utility class for state handling of MDC controls. The StateUtil class is offering a generic way to retrieve states and set a desired state for a given MDC control. The StateUtil class is tightly coupled to the SAPUI5 flexibility integration of MDC controls. To use the APIs of Stateutil, the given MDC control instance needs to fully enable all available p13nMode options. This way, Stateutil can create the required changes and retrieve the relevant state of each control.

methods.name: applyExternalState

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves after all changes have been applied

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control that is used to create changes and to which changes are made

parameters.name: oState
parameters.description: The state in which the control is represented

methods.description:
Creates and applies the necessary changes for a given control and state. Note:The changes are created in the same order as the objects are passed into the state object attributes. For example, by adding two objects into the items attribute of the oState object, the first entry is created, and the second entry is created on top of the first change. The item state is applied for each provided object in the given order in the array and uses the provided position. If no index or only an invalid index has been provided, the item is added to the array after the last item in the affected control's item aggregation. In addition the following attributes can be used to remove a state:
  • filtered - Set to false in the filter scope on condition level to remove one specific condition for the given key.
  • sorted - Set to false in the sorters scope to remove a sorter/code>.
  • grouped - Set to false in the groupLevels scope to remove a grouping.
  • visible - Set to false to remove an aggregation item.
  • aggregated - Set to false to remove an aggregation.
Note:To improve the performance, you should avoid additional calls of the controls delegate. To do this, the propertyInfo property of the relevant control can be enriched with the properties used in the provided state.

methods.name: attachStateChange

parameters.name: fnListener
parameters.description: fnFunction The handler function to call when the event occurs

methods.description: Attaches an event handler to the StateUtil. The event handler may be fired every time a user triggers a personalization change for a control instance during runtime.

parameters.name: fnListener
parameters.description: fnFunction The handler function to detach from the event

methods.description: Removes a previously attached state change event handler from the StateUtil class. The passed parameters must match those used for registration with {@link StateUtil#attachChange} beforehand.

methods.name: diffState

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves after the current state has been diffed

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control instance implementing IxState

parameters.name: oOldState
parameters.description: The prior state

parameters.name: oNewState
parameters.description: The new state

methods.description: Creates a delta between two states.

methods.name: retrieveExternalState

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves after the current state has been retrieved

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control instance implementing IxState to retrieve the externalized state

methods.description: Retrieves the externalized state for a given control instance. The retrieved state is equivalent to the getCurrentState API for the given control, after all necessary changes have been applied (for example, variant appliance and p13n, StateUtil changes). After the returned Promise has been resolved, the returned state is in sync with the according state object of the MDC control (for example, filterConditions for the FilterBar control).

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Table
symbols.description: A metadata-driven table to simplify the usage of existing tables, such as the ResponsiveTable and GridTable controls. The metadata needs to be provided via the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate TableDelegate} implementation as {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.PropertyInfo}.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the table.

properties.name: height
properties.description: This property has no effect and will be rmoved soon.

properties.name: p13nMode
properties.description:
Personalization options for the table.
Note: The order of the options does not influence the position on the UI.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to TableDelegate module that provides the required APIs to create table content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description: Semantic level of the header. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}.

properties.name: headerStyle
properties.description: Defines style of the header. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setTitleStyle}.

properties.name: autoBindOnInit
properties.description: Determines whether to bind the table automatically after the initial creation or re-creation of the table.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Header text that is shown in the table.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Determines whether the header text is shown in the table. Regardless of its value, the given header text is used to label the table correctly for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: useColumnLabelsAsTooltips
properties.description: If no tooltip has been provided for a column, the column header text will automatically be applied as a tooltip for the column.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description:
Selection mode of the table. Specifies whether single or multiple rows can be selected and how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance.

With the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.GridTableType GridTableType} and server-side models, range selections, including Select All, only work properly if the count is known. Make sure the model/binding is configured to request the count from the service.

properties.name: showRowCount
properties.description:
Determines whether the number of rows is shown along with the header text. If set to false, the number of rows is not shown on the user interface.
Note:
For better performance dedicated OData requests should not be sent. The count mode must be configured either in the model or in the binding of the table.
This property can only be used if the back-end service supports row count.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Number of records to be requested from the model. If the type property is set to ResponsiveTable, then it refers to the {@link sap.m.ListBase#getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} property of ResponsiveTable. If the type property is set to Table, then it refers to the {@link sap.ui.table.Table#getThreshold threshold} property of GridTable.
Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the table uses the default value of the corresponding table types.

properties.name: sortConditions
properties.description:
Defines the sort conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description:
Defines the filter conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: groupConditions
properties.description:
Defines the group conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: aggregateConditions
properties.description:
Defines the aggregate conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: enableExport
properties.description: Determines whether the table data export is enabled. To use the export functionality, the {@link sap.ui.export} library is required.

properties.name: busyIndicatorDelay
properties.description: The delay in milliseconds after which the busy indicator is shown.

properties.name: enableColumnResize
properties.description: Determines whether column resizing is enabled.

properties.name: showPasteButton
properties.description: Determines whether the Paste button is visible.

properties.name: enablePaste
properties.description: Determines whether the Paste button is enabled.

properties.name: multiSelectMode
properties.description: Defines the multi-selection mode for the control. If this property is set to the Default value, the ResponsiveTable type control renders the Select All checkbox in the column header, otherwise the Deselect All icon is rendered. This property is used with the selectionMode="Multi". Note: This property has currently no effect for table types other than ResponsiveTable type. This is subject to change in future.

properties.name: enableAutoColumnWidth
properties.description: Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem. Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set.

properties.name: propertyInfo
properties.description: Specifies the table metadata. Whenever the TableDelegate needs to wait for, for example, server-side information to provide the PropertyInfo objects, specifying an array of {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.PropertyInfo PropertyInfo} objects here enables the table to speed up the initial setup. Instead of requesting the PropertyInfo objects from the TableDelegate and waiting for them, the table will use the PropertyInfo objects specified here for rendering-specific tasks, e.g. automatic column width calculation, and to trigger the initial data request. To enable the table for these tasks, certain attributes of a PropertyInfo must be specified. You can find the list of required attributes in the documentation of the PropertyInfo, for example, in {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.PropertyInfo}. This property is processed only once during the instantiation of the table. Any subsequent changes have no effect. Note: This property must not be bound. Note: This property is used exclusively for SAPUI5 flexibility / Fiori Elements. Do not use it otherwise.

aggregations.name: type
aggregations.description: Type of the table.

aggregations.name: columns
aggregations.description: Columns of the table. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the {@link sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil StateUtil}.

aggregations.name: creationRow
aggregations.description: This row can be used for user input to create new data if {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableType TableType} is "Table". Note: Once the binding supports creating transient records, this aggregation will be removed.

aggregations.name: actions
aggregations.description: Additional/external actions available for the table. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the {@link sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil StateUtil}.

aggregations.name: variant
aggregations.description: <code>VariantManagement<code> control for the table.

aggregations.name: quickFilter
aggregations.description: Additional Filter for the table.

aggregations.name: rowSettings
aggregations.description: Settings for the table rows. Note: Each time the properties of the settings are changed, they have to be applied again via setRowSettings for the changes to take effect.

aggregations.name: dataStateIndicator
aggregations.description: DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages. Note: The message filtering is not yet supported for this control. Therefore the {@link sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator#getEnableFiltering enableFiltering} property of the DataStateIndicator plugin must not be set to true.

aggregations.name: noData
aggregations.description: Defines the custom visualization if there is no data to show in the table. Note: If {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage} control is set for the noData aggregation and its {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage#getTitle title} property is not set then the table automatically offers a no data text with fitting {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage.IllustratedMessageType illustration}.

aggregations.name: copyProvider
aggregations.description: Defines an aggregation for the CopyProvider plugin that provides copy to clipboard capabilities for the selected rows of the table and creates a Copy button for the toolbar of the table. To disable the copy function of the table, including the Copy button in the toolbar, the enabled property of the CopyProvider must be set to false. To hide the Copy button from the toolbar, the visible property of the CopyProvider must be set to false. Note: The {@link sap.m.plugins.CopyProvider#extractData extractData} property of the CopyProvider must not be managed by the application. Note: The CopyProvider requires a secure context to access the clipboard API. If the context is not secure, the plugin will not be added, and the copy button will not be generated.

aggregations.name: contextMenu
aggregations.description: Defines the context menu for the table rows.

aggregations.name: cellSelector
aggregations.description: Defines an aggregation for the CellSelector plugin that provides cell selection capabilities to the table. Note: The CellSelector is currently only available in combination with the GridTableType. Please refer to {@link sap.m.plugins.CellSelector} see the addiditional restrictions.

associations.name: filter
associations.description: Control or object that enables the table to do filtering, such as {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar}. See also {@link sap.ui.mdc.IFilter}. Automatic filter generation only works in combination with a sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.

methods.name: _setShowP13nButton
methods.description:
Controls the visibility of the settings button. Note:
  • This setting only takes effect when the given p13nMode makes the button visible.
  • Hiding the button also removes the option for the user to open the personalization dialog. This can lead to situations in which the user can't adjust certain settings although it is required, for example, show some columns again when all columns are hidden.

experimental.text: This setting is only temporary and will be replaced with an alternative API in future releases.

methods.name: focusRow

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves after the focus has been set

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The index of the row that is to be focused

parameters.name: bFirstInteractiveElement
parameters.description: Indicates whether to set the focus on the first interactive element inside the row

methods.description: Sets the focus on the row. If bFirstInteractiveElement is true, and there are interactive elements inside the row, sets the focus on the first interactive element. Otherwise sets the focus on the first data cell, if the type is GridTableType, and on the entire row, if the type is ResponsiveTableType. If the given index is not visible, the table scrolls to it automatically. In this case the same rules apply as in {@link #scrollToIndex}.

methods.name: getActions
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getActions actions}. Additional/external actions available for the table. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the {@link sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil StateUtil}.

methods.name: getAutoBindOnInit

returnValue.description: Value of property autoBindOnInit

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAutoBindOnInit autoBindOnInit}. Determines whether to bind the table automatically after the initial creation or re-creation of the table. Default value is true.

methods.name: getBusyIndicatorDelay

returnValue.description: Value of property busyIndicatorDelay

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBusyIndicatorDelay busyIndicatorDelay}. The delay in milliseconds after which the busy indicator is shown. Default value is 100.

methods.name: getCellSelector
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCellSelector cellSelector}. Defines an aggregation for the CellSelector plugin that provides cell selection capabilities to the table. Note: The CellSelector is currently only available in combination with the GridTableType. Please refer to {@link sap.m.plugins.CellSelector} see the addiditional restrictions.

methods.name: getColumnClipboardSettings

returnValue.description: Clipboard setting object for the provided column.

parameters.name: oColumn
parameters.description: The column for which to get the clipboard settings

methods.description: Returns the clipboard settings for a column.

methods.name: getColumns
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getColumns columns}. Columns of the table. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the {@link sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil StateUtil}.

methods.name: getConditions
methods.description: Returns the current filter conditions present on the table.

methods.name: getContextMenu
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContextMenu contextMenu}.

Defines the context menu for the table rows.

methods.name: getCopyProvider
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCopyProvider copyProvider}. Defines an aggregation for the CopyProvider plugin that provides copy to clipboard capabilities for the selected rows of the table and creates a Copy button for the toolbar of the table. To disable the copy function of the table, including the Copy button in the toolbar, the enabled property of the CopyProvider must be set to false. To hide the Copy button from the toolbar, the visible property of the CopyProvider must be set to false. Note: The {@link sap.m.plugins.CopyProvider#extractData extractData} property of the CopyProvider must not be managed by the application. Note: The CopyProvider requires a secure context to access the clipboard API. If the context is not secure, the plugin will not be added, and the copy button will not be generated.

methods.name: getCreationRow
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCreationRow creationRow}. This row can be used for user input to create new data if {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableType TableType} is "Table". Note: Once the binding supports creating transient records, this aggregation will be removed.

methods.name: getDataStateIndicator
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDataStateIndicator dataStateIndicator}. DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages. Note: The message filtering is not yet supported for this control. Therefore the {@link sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator#getEnableFiltering enableFiltering} property of the DataStateIndicator plugin must not be set to true.

methods.name: getDelegate

returnValue.description: Value of property delegate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDelegate delegate}. Path to TableDelegate module that provides the required APIs to create table content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer. Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: getEnableAutoColumnWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoColumnWidth

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAutoColumnWidth enableAutoColumnWidth}. Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem. Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableColumnResize

returnValue.description: Value of property enableColumnResize

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableColumnResize enableColumnResize}. Determines whether column resizing is enabled. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableExport

returnValue.description: Value of property enableExport

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableExport enableExport}. Determines whether the table data export is enabled. To use the export functionality, the {@link sap.ui.export} library is required. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnablePaste

returnValue.description: Value of property enablePaste

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnablePaste enablePaste}. Determines whether the Paste button is enabled. Default value is true.

methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getFilter filter}, or null.

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.Table.

methods.name: getMultiSelectMode

returnValue.description: Value of property multiSelectMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMultiSelectMode multiSelectMode}. Defines the multi-selection mode for the control. If this property is set to the Default value, the ResponsiveTable type control renders the Select All checkbox in the column header, otherwise the Deselect All icon is rendered. This property is used with the selectionMode="Multi". Note: This property has currently no effect for table types other than ResponsiveTable type. This is subject to change in future. Default value is Default.

methods.name: getNoData
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getNoData noData}. Defines the custom visualization if there is no data to show in the table. Note: If {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage} control is set for the noData aggregation and its {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage#getTitle title} property is not set then the table automatically offers a no data text with fitting {@link sap.m.IllustratedMessage.IllustratedMessageType illustration}.

methods.name: getP13nMode

returnValue.description: Value of property p13nMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getP13nMode p13nMode}. Personalization options for the table.
Note: The order of the options does not influence the position on the UI. Default value is [].

methods.name: getQuickFilter
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getQuickFilter quickFilter}. Additional Filter for the table.

methods.name: getRowBinding

returnValue.description: the row/items binding

methods.description:
Returns the row/items binding of the internal table.
Note:
  • Do not use this API to keep the reference of the binding.
  • Also, do not use it to trigger sort/filter on the binding.

methods.name: getRowSettings
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getRowSettings rowSettings}. Settings for the table rows. Note: Each time the properties of the settings are changed, they have to be applied again via setRowSettings for the changes to take effect.

methods.name: getSelectedContexts

returnValue.description: The selected contexts

methods.description: Gets contexts that have been selected by the user.

methods.name: getSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property selectionMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode}. Selection mode of the table. Specifies whether single or multiple rows can be selected and how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance. With the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.GridTableType GridTableType} and server-side models, range selections, including Select All, only work properly if the count is known. Make sure the model/binding is configured to request the count from the service. Default value is None.

methods.name: getShowPasteButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showPasteButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowPasteButton showPasteButton}. Determines whether the Paste button is visible. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowRowCount

returnValue.description: Value of property showRowCount

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getShowRowCount showRowCount}. Determines whether the number of rows is shown along with the header text. If set to false, the number of rows is not shown on the user interface.
Note:
For better performance dedicated OData requests should not be sent. The count mode must be configured either in the model or in the binding of the table.
This property can only be used if the back-end service supports row count. Default value is true.

methods.name: getThreshold

returnValue.description: Value of property threshold

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getThreshold threshold}. Number of records to be requested from the model. If the type property is set to ResponsiveTable, then it refers to the {@link sap.m.ListBase#getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} property of ResponsiveTable. If the type property is set to Table, then it refers to the {@link sap.ui.table.Table#getThreshold threshold} property of GridTable.
Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the table uses the default value of the corresponding table types. Default value is -1.

methods.name: getType
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getType type}.

Type of the table.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseColumnLabelsAsTooltips useColumnLabelsAsTooltips}. If no tooltip has been provided for a column, the column header text will automatically be applied as a tooltip for the column. Default value is false.

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The index of the row that should be scrolled into the visible area

methods.description: Scrolls the table to the row with the given index. Depending on the table type, this might cause additional requests. If the given index is -1, it will scroll to the end of the table based on the length of the underlying binding. If the length is not final, it will only scroll to the end of the current binding and might trigger a request for additional entries. This also applies in case of a responsive table with growing enabled.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.Column
symbols.description: The column for the metadata-driven table with the template, which is shown if the rows have data.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the column.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Defines the minimum width of the column.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Defines the column header text.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Defines whether the column header is visible.

properties.name: hAlign
properties.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the column content.

properties.name: importance
properties.description: Defines the column importance. The column importance is taken into consideration for calculating the minScreenWidth property and for setting the demandPopin property of the column. See {@link sap.m.Table#getAutoPopinMode} for more details, which is automatically set to true.

properties.name: propertyKey
properties.description: Defines data property related to the column.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Indicates whether the content of the column is required. Note: The table only takes care of announcing the state of the column header as defined by the required property. The application needs to take care of the screen reader announcement of the state of the table cells, for example, by setting the required property to true for sap.m.Input.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used.

The form elements are aligned with the columns of the table and are created automatically based on the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column#getCreationTemplate creationTemplate} aggregation of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.DragDropConfig
symbols.description: Provides the configuration for the drag-and-drop operations of the rows of the table.

properties.name: draggable
properties.description: Determines whether the rows of the table are draggable. Note: Setting this property to true may expose the rows of the table in other DropInfo event parameters. In this case, only the binding context of the row is allowed to be used. Internal controls and their types are subject to change without notice.

properties.name: droppable
properties.description: Determines whether the rows of the table are droppable.

properties.name: dropEffect
properties.description: Defines the visual drop effect.

properties.name: dropPosition
properties.description: Defines the position for the drop action, visualized by a rectangle.

events.name: dragStart
events.description: This event is fired when the user starts dragging a table row, if the draggable property is set to true.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.GridTableType
symbols.description: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.

properties.name: rowCountMode
properties.description: Defines how the table handles the row count.

properties.name: rowCount
properties.description:
Row count of the inner table.
This property specifies the minimum row count if sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableRowCountMode.Auto is used.
This property specifies the row count if sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableRowCountMode.Fixed is used.

properties.name: selectionLimit
properties.description:
Number of indices which can be selected in a range. Accepts positive integer values. If set to 0, the selection limit is disabled, and the Select All checkbox appears instead of the Deselect All button. Note: To avoid severe performance problems, the limit should only be set to 0 in the following cases:
  • With client-side models
  • With server-side models if they are used in client mode
  • If the entity set is small
In other cases, we recommend to set the limit to at least double the value of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table#getThreshold threshold} property of the table.

properties.name: showHeaderSelector
properties.description: Determines whether the header selector is shown.

properties.name: fixedColumnCount
properties.description: Defines the number of fixed columns in the inner table.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.PropertyInfo
symbols.description:
An object literal describing a data property in the context of an {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table}. When specifying the PropertyInfo objects in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table#getPropertyInfo propertyInfo} property, the following attributes need to be specified:
  • name
  • path
  • dataType
  • formatOptions
  • constraints
  • maxConditions
  • caseSensitive
  • visualSettings.widthCalculation
  • propertyInfos
  • groupable
  • key
  • unit
  • text
If the property is complex, the following attributes need to be specified:
  • name
  • visualSettings.widthCalculation
  • propertyInfos (all referenced properties must be specified)

properties.name: filterable
properties.description: Defines whether a property is filterable.

properties.name: sortable
properties.description: Defines whether a property is sortable.

properties.name: groupable
properties.description: Defines whether a property is groupable.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Defines whether a property is a key or part of a key in the data.

properties.name: unit
properties.description: Name of the unit property that is related to this property.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Name of the text property that is related to this property in a 1:1 relation.

properties.name: exportSettings
properties.description: Object that contains information about the export settings, see {@link sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet}.

properties.name: clipboardSettings

template.name: template
template.description: Defines the formatting template that supports indexed placeholders of propertyInfos within curly brackets, for example, "{0} ({1})".

properties.description: Object that contains information about the clipboard settings. Setting this value to null disables the copy function.

properties.name: visualSettings

widthCalculation.name: widthCalculation

minWidth.name: minWidth
minWidth.description: The minimum content width in rem

maxWidth.name: maxWidth
maxWidth.description: The maximum content width in rem

defaultWidth.name: defaultWidth
defaultWidth.description: The default column content width when type check fails

gap.name: gap
gap.description: The additional content width in rem

includeLabel.name: includeLabel
includeLabel.description: Whether the label should be taken into account

truncateLabel.name: truncateLabel
truncateLabel.description: Whether the label should be trucated or not

verticalArrangement.name: verticalArrangement
verticalArrangement.description: Whether the referenced properties are arranged vertically

excludeProperties.name: excludeProperties
excludeProperties.description: A list of invisible referenced property names

widthCalculation.description: This object contains all properties and their default values for the column width calculation

properties.description: This object contains all relevant properties for visual adjustments.

properties.name: propertyInfos
properties.description: The availability of this property makes the PropertyInfo a complex PropertyInfo. Provides a list of related properties (by name). These related properties must not themselves be complex.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveColumnSettings
symbols.description: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.

properties.name: importance
properties.description: Defines the column importance. The column importance is taken into consideration for calculating the minScreenWidth property and for setting the demandPopin property of the column. See {@link sap.m.Table#getAutoPopinMode} for more details, which is automatically set to true.

properties.name: mergeFunction
properties.description: Defines the control serialization function to merge duplicate cells into one cell block. The control itself uses this function to compare values of two duplicate cells. Note: Providing this property will automatically set {@link sap.m.Column#getMergeDuplicates} to true, and the property itself is mapped to {@link sap.m.Column#getMergeFunctionName} of the inner column. Don't set this property for cells for which the content provides a user interaction, such as sap.m.Link.

parameters.description: Optional ID for the new object; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new object

  • importance
  • mergeFunction
Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveTableType
symbols.description: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.

properties.name: growingMode
properties.description: Specifies the growing mode.

properties.name: showDetailsButton
properties.description:
Specifies whether the Show / Hide Details button for the ResponsiveTable scenario is shown. If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area, while the columns with Low importance are hidden.
On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden.
As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area.

properties.name: detailsButtonSetting
properties.description:
Defines which columns are hidden instead of moved into the pop-in area depending on their importance. See {@link sap.m.Column#getImportance} and {@link sap.m.Table#getHiddenInPopin} for more details. Note: To hide columns based on their importance, it's mandatory to set showDetailsButton="true".
If no priority is given, the default configuration of {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveTableType#getShowDetailsButton} is used.
If this property is changed after the Table has been initialized, the new changes take effect only when the Show / Hide Details button is pressed a second time.

properties.name: popinLayout
properties.description: Defines the layout in which the table pop-in rows are rendered.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.RowActionItem
symbols.description: The RowActionItem control represents a action for a row. This control can only be used in the context of sap.ui.mdc.Table control to define row actions.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of the row action item. As of version 1.98, only sap.ui.mdc.enums.TableRowAction.Navigation is available. Setting the type ensures default values for the properties icon and text. If an icon or text is set explicitly this setting is used.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Text for the row action item. Custom text cannot be set when using sap.m.Table.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Icon for the row action item. A custom icon cannot be set when using sap.m.Table

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the item should be visible on the screen.

events.name: press
events.description: Fired when the row action item is pressed. sap.ui.table.Table: The press event is fired when a row action item is pressed. sap.m.Table: The press event is fired when a row with a row action item is pressed. The sap.ui.mdc.Table's rowPress event is fired as well, when pressing a row with a row action item.

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: The binding context of the pressed row action

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings
symbols.description: The RowSettings control is used to configure a row. This control can only be used in the context of the sap.ui.mdc.Table control to define row settings.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description: The highlight state of the rows. If the highlight is set to {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType sap.ui.core.MessageType.None} (default), no highlights are visible. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

properties.name: highlightText
properties.description: Defines the semantics of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings#setHighlight highlight} property for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: navigated
properties.description: The navigated state of a row. If set to true, a navigation indicator is displayed at the end of the row.

aggregations.name: rowActions
aggregations.description:
The available actions for a row.

rowActions cannot be bound with a factory. Additionally, {@link sap.m.Table} only works with row actions of type navigation.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.util.PromiseCache
symbols.description: Provides a caching mechanism for promises. This API features Promise cancellation: resolve or reject handlers won't be called after removal of the promise, cache destruction or manual cancellation. Destroying the cache will cancel all registered promises and delete references. Convenience methods for promise creation, wrapping and replacement are offered.

methods.name: add

returnValue.description: Returns the newly created Promise

parameters.name: sName
parameters.description: Promise identifier

parameters.name: fnCreate
parameters.description: creation method or pre-created promise

methods.description:
Adds a promise to the promise cache using a string identifier and a creation method or given Promise. Calling add using an already existing identifier will cancel and replace the existing promise. Note: All unsettled promises will be cancelled on removal or cache destruction A given creation method will receive the following arguments on execution:
  • oPromise - The newly created Promise
  • fnResolve - Resolve method for the newly created Promise
  • fnReject - Reject method for the newly created Promise
  • fnRemove - Remove method for the newly created Promise

methods.name: cancel

returnValue.description: Returns the canceled Promise

parameters.name: vPromise
parameters.description: Promise or identifier

methods.description: Cancels an unsettled promise from the promise cache. Calling cancel twice is a no-op.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.util.PromiseCache.

methods.name: reject

returnValue.description: Returns the rejected Promise

parameters.name: vPromise
parameters.description: Promise or identifier

parameters.name: oValue
parameters.description: Promise error

methods.description: Rejects an existing promise from the promise cache

methods.name: remove

parameters.name: vPromise
parameters.description: Promise or identifier

methods.description: Removes an existing promise from the promise cache

methods.name: resolve

returnValue.description: Returns the resolved Promise

parameters.name: vPromise
parameters.description: Promise or identifier

parameters.description: Promise result

methods.description: Resolves an existing promise from the promise cache

methods.name: retrieve

returnValue.description: Returns the newly created Promise

parameters.name: sName

parameters.description: creation method or pre-created promise

methods.description:
Retrieves an existing promise from the promise cache. Automatically creates and returns a new promise if fnCreate is given. A given creation method will receive the following arguments on execution:
  • oPromise - The newly created Promise
  • fnResolve - Resolve method for the newly created Promise
  • fnReject - Reject method for the newly created Promise
  • fnRemove - Remove method for the newly created Promise

methods.name: retrieveMany

returnValue.description: Returns the retrieved promises

parameters.name: sName
parameters.description: Promise identifier(s)

methods.description: Retrieves multiple promises from the promise cache Will return all cached promises if no arguments are given

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.util.PropertyInfo
symbols.description: An object literal describing a data property.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique, stable key for the property. It must only contain characters allowed for IDs, see {@link sap.ui.core.ID}. Does not have to be an existing attribute in the data model or the technical name of an attribute in the data model.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The technical path for a data source property.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Translatable text that labels the property.

properties.name: tooltip
properties.description: Translatable text that can optionally be offered as tooltip (For example in a personalization dialog).

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the property is or can be visible to a user.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of filter conditions for the property. Possible values that can be used:
  • 1 is a single-filter expression field
  • -1 is a multi-filter expression field
This information is, for example, used in the addItem method of the FilterBar control to forward this information to the created FilterField instance.

properties.name: dataType
properties.description: The name of the data type

properties.name: formatOptions
properties.description: Defines the format options for the data type

properties.name: constraints
properties.description: Defines the constraints for the data type

properties.name: group
properties.description: Key of the group the property is inside. Used to visually group properties in personalization dialogs.

properties.name: groupLabel
properties.description: Translatable text of the group.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description: Whether filtering by this property is case-sensitive.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp
symbols.description: The ValueHelp element can be assigned to the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField}, and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls using the valueHelp association. One ValueHelp element instance can be assigned to multiple fields (like in different table rows). It should be placed in the control tree on the container holding the fields.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description: The conditions of the selected items. Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description: The value by which the help is filtered. Here the field provides the typed value to allow the value help to filter for it. Note: This only takes effect if the ValueHelp elements content supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

properties.name: validateInput
properties.description:
If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

properties.name: _config
properties.description: internal configuration

properties.name: _valid
properties.description: Internal property to allow to bind the valid state to OK Button or make it available for all content controls

aggregations.description: Container that is used and opened if the value help icon of the input field is pressed.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getConditions conditions}. The conditions of the selected items. Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}. Default value is [].

methods.name: getDelegate

returnValue.description: Value of property delegate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDelegate delegate}. Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization. Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: getDialog
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDialog dialog}.

Container that is used and opened if the value help icon of the input field is pressed.

methods.name: getFilterValue

returnValue.description: Value of property filterValue

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterValue filterValue}. The value by which the help is filtered. Here the field provides the typed value to allow the value help to filter for it. Note: This only takes effect if the ValueHelp elements content supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getIcon

returnValue.description: Name of the icon. If null no value help icon will be shown and it is used only as typeahead.

methods.description: Determines the icon for the value help.

methods.name: getItemForValue

returnValue.description: Promise returning object containing description, key and payload.

parameters.name: oConfig
parameters.description: Configuration

throws.description: if entry is not found or not unique

methods.description: Determines the item (key and description) for a given value. The value help checks if there is an item with a key or description that fits this value. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValuedHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp.

methods.name: getTypeahead
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getTypeahead typeahead}.

Container that is used and opened in typeahead

methods.name: getValidateInput

returnValue.description: Value of property validateInput

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValidateInput validateInput}. If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field. If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.) Default value is true.

methods.name: initBeforeOpen

parameters.name: bTypeahead
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether value help is opened for type-ahead or for complex help

methods.description: Calls initialization of the ValueHelp element before the value help is really opened. This is called during type-ahead when the user types the first letter and before the value help is opened with a delay. This way the content can be determined in the delegate coding early. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isFocusInHelp

returnValue.description: if true, focus goes to the value help, if false it stays in the calling control.

methods.description: Determines if the focus is set in the value help or stays in the calling control.

methods.name: isNavigationEnabled

returnValue.description: If true, the navigation should be enabled if value help is closed

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description:
Determines if navigation via arrow keys should be possible.

In ComboBox-like case keyboard-navigation should be anabled if closed and if open. If only typeahead is used (and maybe an value help dialog) keyboard-navigation schould be enabled only if typeahed is open.

As not all rowas might be loaded navigation with home, end, page up or dowm might be disabled, depending of the used content.

methods.name: isOpen

returnValue.description: true if open or opening

methods.description: Determines if the value help is open. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isTypeaheadSupported

returnValue.description: if true, the field help should open by typing. The result might be returned asynchronously, so a Promise is used.

methods.description: Determines if the value help should be opened when something is typed into the field. Opening the value help must be triggered by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isValidationSupported

returnValue.description: True if value help can be used for input validation

methods.description: Defines if the value help can be used for input validation.

methods.name: navigate

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description: Triggers navigation in the value help. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: onControlChange
methods.description: Triggers some logic that must be executed in ValueHelp element if a Change event on the connected control is fired. This is done if the corresponding control value is changed (not during navigation). Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: open

parameters.name: bTypeahead
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether value help is opened for type-ahead or for complex help

methods.description: Opens the value help for the control to which the ValueHelp element is connected. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: removeFocus
methods.description: The focus visualization of the field help needs to be removed as the user starts typing into the field.

If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field. If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. methods.description: Determines if the value help should be opened when the user clicks into the connected control. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

These modules must not be used stand-alone.

properties.name: contentId
properties.description: ID of the current content control the calling control should point to (for example the table inside the popover)

properties.description: value of the aria-roledescription attribute

properties.description: If set a valueHelpEnabled text is announced

properties.name: autocomplete

returnValue.description: True if used as dialog

methods.description: Determines if the container is used as dialog inside the value help. The container is also used as dialog if useAsValueHelp is set on content and no other dialog is set. Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

returnValue.description: if true, focus goes to the value help, if false it stays in the calling control.

methods.description: Determines if the focus is set in the value help or stays in the calling control.

methods.name: isNavigationEnabled

returnValue.description: If true, the navigation should be enabled if value help is closed

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description:
Determines if navigation via arrow keys should be possible.

In ComboBox-like case keyboard-navigation should be anabled if closed and if open. If only typeahead is used (and maybe an value help dialog) keyboard-navigation schould be enabled only if typeahed is open.

As not all rowas might be loaded navigation with home, end, page up or dowm might be disabled, depending of the used content.

methods.description:
Determines if navigation via arrow keys should be possible.

In ComboBox-like case keyboard-navigation should be anabled if closed and if open. If only typeahead is used (and maybe an value help dialog) keyboard-navigation schould be enabled only if typeahed is open.

As not all rows might be loaded, navigation with home, end, page up or dowm might be disabled, depending on the used content.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.DefineConditionPanel
symbols.description: A DefineConditionPanel control is used inside the ValueHelp content to enter different types of conditions.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description: Sets the conditions that represent the selected values of the help. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

properties.name: config
properties.description: Internal configuration Note: This property must not be set from outside, it used to forward the configuration of the ValueHelp

properties.name: label
properties.description: The label for the DefineConditionPanel used as panel headerText.

properties.name: inputOK
properties.description: If set, there has been no invalid user input. Note: This property must not be set from outside. It is a property because that way it can be bound to the ManagedObjectModel of the calling value help and automatically update it.

properties.name: _pagination
properties.description: Indicates if pagination is active

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description: Internal content that is rendered.

associations.name: fieldHelp
associations.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for the value fields for the DefineConditionPanel. Note: The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp with a TypeAhead and single-selection MTable can be used. Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.

associations.name: valueHelp
associations.description: Optional ValueHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for the value fields for the DefineConditionPanel. Note: The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp with a TypeAhead and single-selection MTable can be used. Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time, no ValueHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.

properties.name: filterFields
properties.description: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering, the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search, and if the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

deprecated.text: replaced in future version by {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelpDelegate.isSearchSupported isSearchSupported}

properties.description: BindingContext of the checked field. Inside a table, the ValueHelp element might be connected to a different row.

properties.name: checkKey
properties.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given key. This is set to false if the value cannot be a valid key because of type validation.

properties.name: checkDescription
properties.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given description. This is set to false if only the key is used in the field.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description: If set, the check is done case-sensitively

properties.name: control
properties.description: Instance of the calling control

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.ListContent
symbols.description: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description: If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.

properties.name: useFirstMatch
properties.description: If set, getItemForValue returns the first item that matches the text. In the default implementation, this is the first item that matches the entered text. Which item is used can be determined by implementing {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelpDelegate#getFirstMatch}. The matching item is returned in the typeaheadSuggested event and used for the autocomplete feature in the connected field.

properties.name: useAsValueHelp
properties.description: If set, the list is opened whenever the value help icon is pressed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.Conditions
symbols.description: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element showing a condition panel.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Label shown on condition panel.

associations.name: fieldHelp
associations.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for the value fields for the Conditions. Note: The value fields on the conditions UI cannot be accessed from outside. The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp>/code> with a TypeAhead and a single-selection MTable can be used. Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time types, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

associations.name: valueHelp
associations.description: Optional ValueHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for the value fields for the Conditions. Note: The value fields on the conditions UI cannot be accessed from outside. The fields are single-value input, and the display is always set to FieldDisplay.Value. Only a ValueHelp>/code> with a TypeAhead and a single-selection MTable can be used. Note: For Boolean, Date, or Time types, no ValueHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.

symbols.description: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element showing a list with fixed values.

properties.name: groupable
properties.description: If set, the items of the list can be grouped

properties.name: filterList
properties.description: If set, the items of the list are filtered based on filterValue. If a type-ahead behavior for the connected field is wanted, this property must be set to true. For small lists, all values are meant to be shown, independent of the typing in the connected field. In this case this property must be set to false. If not set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Items of the value help. The key of the items is not shown in the list, but is used as a value of the connected field. If the additionalText for all the items is not used, the column will not be displayed. Note: Icons are currently not supported.

parameters.name: oGroupConfig
parameters.description: New value for property groupConfig

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getGroupConfig groupConfig}. Configuration for groups (collective search). The object needs to contain an entry for every possible group. The labels of every group need to have a structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.GroupLabel}. If no configuration is provided a standard text "search and select" is used. Sample: 
{
group1: {label: "Label 1", nnLabel: "Label 1 ({0})"},
group2: {label: "Label 2", nnLabel: "Label 2 ({0})"}
}
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is {}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Popover
symbols.description: Container for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp} element showing a popover.

properties.name: opensOnClick
properties.description: Controls the possibility to open this popover container by clicking on a connected control, even if no content enforces it. Note: By default, a type-ahead is only shown to provide suggestions when users enter input in a connected control. This property enables scenarios where popovers need to be shown earlier (for example, recommendations or recently entered values). See also {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelpDelegate.showTypeahead showTypeahead}

properties.name: opensOnFocus
properties.description: Controls the possibility to open this popover container by focussing on a connected control. Note: By default, a type-ahead is only shown to provide suggestions when users enter input in a connected control. This property enables scenarios where popovers need to be shown earlier (for example, recommendations or recently entered values). See also {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelpDelegate.showTypeahead showTypeahead}

methods.name: setOpensOnClick

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bOpensOnClick
parameters.description: New value for property opensOnClick

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOpensOnClick opensOnClick}. Controls the possibility to open this popover container by clicking on a connected control, even if no content enforces it. Note: By default, a type-ahead is only shown to provide suggestions when users enter input in a connected control. This property enables scenarios where popovers need to be shown earlier (for example, recommendations or recently entered values). See also {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelpDelegate.showTypeahead showTypeahead} When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setOpensOnFocus

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bOpensOnFocus
parameters.description: New value for property opensOnFocus

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOpensOnFocus opensOnFocus}. Controls the possibility to open this popover container by focussing on a connected control. Note: By default, a type-ahead is only shown to provide suggestions when users enter input in a connected control. This property enables scenarios where popovers need to be shown earlier (for example, recommendations or recently entered values). See also {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelpDelegate.showTypeahead showTypeahead} When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.ValueHelpItem
symbols.description:
Item object type. This represents an abstract item from the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp}.

If an item is requested using a description or key, an object with the following properties is returned.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Key of the item

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the item

properties.name: payload
properties.description: Payload of the item.
